alert.note: Alert for Hickory; St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 2:29PM CDT until July 17 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Hickory County in central Missouri... Southeastern St. Clair County in west central Missouri... * Until 315 PM CDT. * At 228 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Weaubleau, or 10 miles west of Hermitage, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Pomme de Terre Lake, Pittsburg, Weaubleau, Wheatland, Collins, Flemington, Gerster and Elkton. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Pomme de Terre Lake, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
